rComments: Peter is the best professor I have encountered at UofT thus far. Incredible!

toughest prof i've ever encountered. midterm test hard af, i almost didnt finish, and once u answer one question wrong, the following ones would probably be wrong too since all of them are connected. i would say he's good as a lecturer but the questions he gave is just soooo hard and heavy in terms of amount
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', 'Test heavy', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: The textbook that he wrote himself is very clear and well-organized, and he gives his students its pdf version for free. Great prof. I don't usually write reviews but I had to give him credits, as I am now realizing how great of a prof he is when compared to Susan Bejar who teaches LIN102. Don't take LIN102 taught by her.

He's one of the few professors who actually cares about their students and will do everything possible to help you succeed even though the course content is very challenging. He wrote his own textbook for LIN101 which is extremely useful. He makes weekly homework and extra practice questions, practice exams, help labs and online discussion boards.

Jurgec is a great lecturer, integrating memes flawlessly into his clear slide content. Jurgec is great at making the material easy to understand and super easy to study for. He made the grading criteria really easy to understand and is brilliantly organized, providing really accurate practice exams, summaries of materials needed for tests, etc.

I really enjoyed this class, only serious critique would be that the lectures moved very quickly, which made it hard to get good notes down. However, he always posted the slides online either right before or right after the lecture.
Very by the book. Not helpful unless by his own terms. Difficult stuff and often not explained well.

The professor is nice but as someone who took this as an elective (not intending to major or take other courses in linguistics) the content could get quite confusing, and to get a good mark you would definitely have to invest time to read and understand the material. The course is not impossible, but not a bird course

This course made me fall in love with linguistics. The prof made a rather dry content exciting using memes, videos, and lots of interactive content. He wore fun shirts. The workload was a bit on the heavy side but the expectations were clear. Would recommend.

His lecture is very interesting and useful. So, attend the lecture! He does Iclicker thing every lecture. He is a reasonable marker. You will have homework every week except the week before test and exam. Homework is so-so if you study and read the textbook. For me, it was not that hard course. If you do your best, you will get at least A-.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Clear grading criteria', 'Amazing lectures']

rComments: The way he broke down the grading scheme was honestly a blessing: we had two tests instead of a single midterm half way through the course, and on top of the usual weekly assignments we got to do a language project, which gave us a chance to get a little bit of field experience.  He was also a great lecturer and was always open to answer questions.

Peter is an amazing prof (honestly my favourite)! He weighed the class with as many small assignments (easy marks!) as he could so that the final would weigh the least possible amount allowed. His lectures are lovely, and while the content is difficult, you can tell he really wants to help you succeed. Thanks for the memes and candy, Peter!
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Lots of homework', 'Hilarious']

rComments: Peter's lecture is really enjoyable. He is a nice guy. Whenever you have any difficulty just go to him, he provides tremendous help.

Prof. Jurgec is a terrific Linguistics professor who takes time to answer questions and is always smiley during lectures. He is really good at explaining and the tone because of his accent sort of makes me laugh sometimes.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Gives good feedback', 'Lots of homework']
